metadata.title: CVE-2024-28085 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
wall in util-linux through 2.40, often installed with setgid ttypermissions, allows escape sequences to be sent to other users' terminalsthrough argv. (Specifically, escape sequences received from stdin areblocked, but escape sequences received from argv are not blocked.) Theremay be plausible scenarios where this leads to account takeover.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-28085` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bsdextrautils - 2.37.2-4ubuntu3.3
eject - 2.37.2-4ubuntu3.3
fdisk - 2.37.2-4ubuntu3.3
libblkid1 - 2.37.2-4ubuntu3.3
libfdisk1 - 2.37.2-4ubuntu3.3
libmount1 - 2.37.2-4ubuntu3.3
libsmartcols1 - 2.37.2-4ubuntu3.3
libuuid1 - 2.37.2-4ubuntu3.3
mount - 2.37.2-4ubuntu3.3
rfkill - 2.37.2-4ubuntu3.3
util-linux - 2.37.2-4ubuntu3.3
util-linux-locales - 2.37.2-4ubuntu3.3
uuid-runtime - 2.37.2-4ubuntu3.3
bsdutils - 1:2.37.2-4ubuntu3.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: util-linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.37.2-4ubuntu3.3').
